intro: Jatropha villosa var. ramnadensis, commonly known as the Ramnad milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern India. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The species is also noted for its latex-containing sap, which can be toxic.
